Detailed Description

Error codes and interface of error management functions.

Definition at line 165 of file liberror.h.

Referenced by handle_connection(), handle_execution_request(), kurud_console_init(), listen_socket(), and lock_file().

#define ERR ( REASON   )     ERR_HANDLER(ERROR_CONTEXT, ERROR_CODE, ERROR_PRINT, ERROR_CALLBACK, REASON);

Treats an error using predefined constants. The symbols ERROR_CONTEXT, ERROR_CODE, ERROR_TARGET, ERROR_PRINT and ERROR_CALBACK must be defined prior to call. The symbol ERROR_CONTEXT can be NULL if the module using the library does not have a context object.

Parameters:
[in] REASON - the reason that caused the error

#define FATAL ( REASON   )     ERR_HANDLER(ERROR_CONTEXT, ERROR_CODE, ERROR_PRINT_FATAL, ERROR_CALLBACK, REASON);

Treats a fatal error. The symbols ERROR_CONTEXT, ERROR_CODE, ERROR_TARGET, ERROR_PRINT and ERROR_CALBACK must be defined prior to call. The symbol ERROR_CONTEXT can be NULL if the module using the library does not have a context object.

Prints the error message with detailed information.
